fact_check_explanation_title: Shaun Bailey’s comments on the congestion charge lack context
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Conservative London mayoral candidate claimed Sadiq Khan’s decision to raise the congestion charge was his own. It was essentially a requirement of a government bailout package.

fact_check_explanation_title: Washing your glasses with soap can help prevent fogging when wearing a mask
fact_check_explanation_summary: The soap disrupts the surface tension which causes the fogging.

fact_check_explanation_title: Misleading claims on pre-existing conditions and Covid-19 deaths go viral
fact_check_explanation_summary: A Facebook post makes a false claim about the Covid-19 death rate.

fact_check_explanation_title: Surgical masks may offer some protection to the wearer from Covid-19 and may stop them from infecting others
fact_check_explanation_summary: Masks may offer some limited protection to the wearer and are likely to protect others if the wearer is infectious.

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s not true that employees who have to quarantine cannot be ‘penalised’
fact_check_explanation_summary: Dominic Raab wrongly claimed people cannot be ‘penalised’ by employers if they have to quarantine after being abroad.

fact_check_explanation_title: You do not have to legally lower your mask for lip-readers
fact_check_explanation_summary: Lowering your mask to assist those who lip-read is allowed, but not legally required.

fact_check_explanation_title: Changes to government Covid-19 death data won’t make a big difference to the overall death count
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government has demanded an urgent review into the way Public Health England calculates the daily death figures from coronavirus.

fact_check_explanation_title: There is no indication that a Covid-19 vaccine will be mandatory or that those who don’t get it will have their movements restricted
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post claims that an app containing a QR code will be used to stop people entering shops or businesses if they haven’t had the vaccine.

fact_check_explanation_title: Many children have been the victims of grooming gangs, but there’s no evidence for a figure of one million
fact_check_explanation_summary: We can’t objectively compare the public response to grooming gangs with Black Lives Matter

fact_check_explanation_title: It’s incorrect to say there was no resistance to safety measures around the Blitz
fact_check_explanation_summary: There are multiple examples of people failing to follow Blitz guidance.

fact_check_explanation_title: The government was wrong on its own data on Covid-19 tests for care homes
fact_check_explanation_summary: Boris Johnson and the Department for Health and Social Care claimed in May 125,000 staff in care settings and 118,000 care home residents had been tested for Covid-19. New data …

fact_check_explanation_title: Layla Moran’s child malnutrition figures are wrong
fact_check_explanation_summary: Three hospitals say they had far fewer child malnutrition admissions than was reported. Other questions remain unresolved.
